name: Taylar TLC
text:
This is an update to my original review upon receiving a call and efforts to make it right from Marc the Service Manager.  As you all know, many businesses won't even take the time to contact a lost customer.  Marc not only reached out but followed up with us to confirm we were taken care of, even though we had to pull our truck.  He made no excuses and stated that the communication errors were taken seriously and will be addressed.  Ultimately our repair had to been completed elsewhere but Williams still followed up and showed accountability.  I would be comfortable continuing to use W.W. Williams as I have at various locations.  However, I would advise that you seek assistance from Management if communication is lacking.  I wish we had done so sooner.

Be aware that every experience isn't the same.  We had a truck towed in to this location due to the good reviews and communication with the tech on our call.  We were told that our truck would be looked at first thing the following day.  Day 1, truck not looked at, we were told someone went home sick.  This was after we called to get an update.  We were told it would be looked at the following a.m.
Day 2,  I we provided the potential location of the issue after speaking with our home mechanic.  We asked how pics could be sent to get things rolling.  We emailed a pic of the part and diagnostic which was from a recent repair of another unit with the same problem.  We followed back up after not hearing anything mid day.  The truck was not looked at by mid-day we were told this time 2 people were out.
Day 3, Calls and face to face contact again resulted in no action, the truck was not looked at.
Day 4, We went to location to try to nail down a realistic expectation of when the truck would be touched.  We were told they would try by late afternoon but could not say for sure, this came from advisement with the shop supervisor.

This has been the worst experience we have had with a WW Williams which we use often locally.  Our confidence in towing the truck was due to the quality of work and professionalism we experienced in the past.  This location has not met the standard exemplified by the WW Williams name.  Truitt has not followed up with us nor provided a realistic time table to address the misinformation provided prior to the town in.  We understand staff issues occur, especially in the current pandemic climate.  However, there is no excuse for not providing updates nor treating all customers with the same level of priority.  The business is open, there are technicians present, and trucks being worked on.  Yet, we have not been serviced nor updated with an expected diagnostic date.  The cost of being out of service has been extended due to the poor service standard.  Beware before taking your truck here.  Sitting and no communication is not a reasonable expectation and very costly in trucking.

resp.text: Thank you so much for updating this and we do hope that we can do better for you in the future!

name: Bach Wilson
text:
This company took advantage of us and ripped us off.

I am a mechanic, but I don't often vacation with all of my tools, so I know what I am talking about here.

We suffered transmission problems on our motor home on Memorial Day weekend. AAA got us in touch with W. W. Williams. I described our problem over the phone to W. W. Williams. The front seal was leaking badly, our transmission was functioning normally as long as it had fluid in it, however was leaking too rapidly to drive. The mechanic on call nearly insisted that he come out and have a look at it on site, however I told him there was nothing that could be done on the side of the road. We decided we would spend the night on the side of the road and have it towed to W. W. Williams the next day.

The next day we had the RV towed to W. W. Williams. The mechanic on call insisted that we let him come out and put the RV inside the gates, even though we were not worried about it as it was a very industrial area. The mechanic came out and was nice and spent about 10 minutes installing the driveshaft since it had been removed by the towing company. We again explained and showed him the problem and he assured us that it would be no big deal for them to repair. The shop was very nice and appeared to be well equipped. The mechanic estimated 8-10 hours labor for the repair. He waited another 20 minutes for our ride home to arrive and we left.

A few days later W. W. Williams called to say that they could not repair our RV. They said that since it was leaking from the front seal, they wouldn't have the tooling. They charged $600 to tell us this, which is very upsetting because I told them that was what the problem was from square one and several more times after that. They justified their price by a minimum 4 hour charge for the guy to meet us to put it behind the gate, and then a inspection fee on top of that to glance underneath the camper. Their seasoned mechanic should have been able to make that call right away, and charging for an inspection is ridiculous as this could and should have been done by the mechanic while we were paying for his 4hr service call, he had plenty of time for that as he was with us for an hour or less. The tooling is also a very lame excuse.

This company clearly took advantage of us, and figured they could make an easy profit without having to touch our RV. Life is expensive enough as it is, we don't need to gouge each other. I am really upset that I told them our problem from the very beginning and they still put us through all of this.
call right awaycl

name: Kathy Gwizdala
text: We recently had Baldwin Heating & Air Conditioning install a Generac Generator for our home on Mobile Bay. We are so very happy with our overall experience with this company. In fact (no lie) less than two hours after the final hook-up, there was a sudden storm, the electricity went out and the generator came on. It was seamless!!! We did have a misunderstanding with the salesman but once we brought it to the attention of Steve Dukes, the business owner, he quickly and decisively took care of it. Because we are on the Bay, we wanted the generator elevated so that, should there be flooding, the generator would be safe. That request hadn't been conveyed to the installers. However, when Mr. Dukes was made aware of the oversight, he actually constructed a metal stand for us himself. Plus he did this very quickly so that the delay was minimal. We were thinking they would build us a wooden platform, but the metal one is much better — both functionally (as it will last longer) and aesthetically. We are from Michigan and we had no intention of being here through hurricane season but we had traveled here with my 94 year old mother and, because of the coronavirus, she couldn’t fly back and she can’t physically tolerate such a long drive.  I was afraid that, because of the misunderstanding, we would be relegated to the bottom of the list and have to wait until they could “get around to it” because they were so busy...not so! There was only a slight delay while the frame was fabricated. So, fast forward to the present time: We had “bugged out” when Hurricane Sally was about 100 miles South of us and just now walked into the door after Sally had passed through. There is no electricity on either side of us but we walked into the door with the generator humming reassuringly beside the house. I don’t have to worry about Moms Bi-Pap or oxygen condenser working. She will be able to sleep comfortably tonight...and so will I. Mr. Dukes made sure we had the generator installed the way we wanted it and in a timely manner, smoothing out the bumps along the way. I definitely recommend getting a whole house (Generac) generator and I highly recommend doing business with Mr. Dukes of Baldwin Heating & Air Conditioning. He knows his business and is a man of integrity.

resp.text: Kathy thank you so much. It was a pleasure working with you.

name: Carrie Andrews
text: My  elderly fathers air conditioner went out suddenly and he called Baldwin Heating & Air Conditioning for the first time. When the mechanic arrived he immediatly started in on a sales pitch saying the three year old a/c was not worth repairing due to its age. He wasted over thirty minutes at $100.00 an hour trying to sell us on a new unit  before he even took his tools out of his truck. After one hour into the diagnosis he tells us he needs a part and will return shortly and he leaves. We wait without a/c for over two hours for him to run to get the parts. When he returns he quickly replaces what he calls the capacitor. We had to pay $685.50 for the total repair, $125.00 of which was the part When we were cleaning up his mess we found the reciept from Solar Supply for the part he purchased. That $125.00 part cost them $6.20 , The mechanic also charged us for four pounds of freon and he never even removed the freon caps from the a/c. I feel violated and would not recommend this company to my worst enemy. I will be calling the BBB

name: Judson E Crump
text:
A bit disappointing.  3 months ago, our AC unit wasn't cooling as well as it should.  So we called Baldwin HVAC.  They sent a guy to come out and look at it.  He looked briefly at the unit, walked around the house for a few minutes with a thermometer, and quickly pronounced that there was nothing wrong, and that all we needed was to change our air filters.  So they charged us $39 for the visit (the fee they quote you) plus $50 for "labor," which I guess is that guy's rate for walking around your house for 10 minutes.

Obviously, I keep my filters changed, so I was suspicious, but I assumed that he knew what he was talking about.  2 weeks ago, our AC stops working completely.   Before calling anyone, I go into the attic and check it out myself.  The coils were completely frozen.  And not only that - they were clogged with dust and mold.  This was due to our blower motor malfunctioning, which had been happening slowly for some time at that point.

I took a photo to show how bad it was.  Naturally, I called Baldwin HVAC to ask how their guy missed something so obvious.  The manager, Anthony, said that the initial $89 visit "didn't include" looking at the coils, even though it took me - an ordinary guy with no HVAC expertise - literally 5 minutes to open up the blower and look in there.

Like an fool, I believed him, and so hired them to come out and fix the blower motor that had gone bad.  Their guy John came and he was nice and did a good job.

But the next day, the same AC unit goes dead again.  This time, the problem is the outdoor compressor.  So I call them to come check it out.

They charge us yet another $89 to come and look at the same AC system they'd worked on the very day before.  This time, we resist their high-pressure sales tactics ("It's 4 PM, so if you want the AC working tomorrow, we need to order the part now! ") and call a different company to work on the compressor.  Baldwin HVAC quoted us $822 to replace the part (which was covered by warranty).  We went to Climatemp instead, and they charged us $550 for the exact same job.  They got the part that same day and had a guy out there the very next morning.

Long story short: I'd recommend someone else first, if only because these people charge more than other companies, and in my experience, the quality of the work just wasn't sufficient to justify the extra cost.

name: Jessica Stephens
text:
Giving 3 stars only because it is the average between the two components of service received.

Technicians/Product Installation - Five Stars! Over-the-top knowledgeable, courteous and timely!

Communication/Interaction with Jacob Oswalt - ZERO stars. Very snarky, condescending and entitled when he could have just been transparent. Followed through with the install only because our AC was already completely out.

New units work great and we are so happy it is done, but I definitely would not recommend this company.  Too many other reputable companies that are not such a pain to deal with.

resp.text:
Jessica,

I am glad you are happy with the installation. I am sorry the rest of your experience was not satisfactory. We did our best to work with you on an expedited schedule given your existing system was not operational. We were able to move you up from the original scheduled date to get your systems installed sooner. Most of our communication was after hours and over email, so I'm sorry if it came off as snarky or condescending as that was not my intention. Sometimes things get lost in translation over electronic versus verbal communication. I am glad the installation went well and that we were able to get your new systems installed in a timely manner. I apologize again for any misunderstanding or miscommunication and hope you will consider us in the future for your HVAC needs. Please let us know if you need anything else. - Jacob Oswalt

name: Tony Nichols
text:
I recently used Capital Heating and Cooling to install a 22kw Generac generator at my home.  I was extremely pleased with the service I received.  Tommy Oswalt came out and did an initial site assessment and gave me a very realistic look at all the work necessary and the expense involved.

Once the generator arrived, technicians Ben House, Eric Gray and Colby Winham came out to pour a pad on the slope beside my house.   Because of the steep slope, they had to build a form to pour a slab for the generator to sit on.  Our generator was installed the next week and being in the service industry myself, I was very interested in each stage of the process.  The guys all did a fantastic job of making the installation look neat. name: Mark Williams
text: Capital Heating & Cooling replaced the A/C portion (indoor evaporator coils and outdoor condenser coils) of two Trane HVAC systems at my home, one for the main level and one for upstairs. I am very happy with their work. They took the step of identifying that the original pvc piping used for the drain for the unit in the attic was not draining effectively (a worker in the attic poured a gallon of water into it while another worker in the garage observed and noted the water did not make it to the drain in the garage) and they corrected that, mounting fasteners in multiple places along the PVC pipe to ensure it sloped properly in its run across the attic, and they replaced the rusted overflow tray beneath the HVAC unit. They also eliminated the traps in the drains for both units, which is where algae would always build up; the traps were apparently redundant because both drains feed into a drain in the garage floor that has a trap beneath the concrete floor. They left straight cleanouts in place of the p-traps which should reduce algae buildup, and I can still pour vinegar or chlorine to reduce algae. The three workers, Bobby, Jason, and Matt seemed trustworthy and very competent. The installation looks really well-done.

name: HawkPilotUSA
text: After years of performing my own spark plug, oil change, filter change and basic upkeep and documenting each service...I called Current Electrical to schedule a service and firmware upgrade. I do not have the capability or knowledge to update the unit and couple that with another spine issue preventing me from the physical aspect of the task- it was the logical choice to call the folks that sold me the unit.   I was told that if more than a year passed without them performing a service that I would pay an additional $198 on top of the $289 service.  After receiving over $5000 from my family for a 22kw Generac generator installation they have the nerve to charge what I see as a penalty of $198 because I didn’t use their services every year.  A basic service for me costs approximately $50-$60 to purchase the Generac OEM kit.  My labor is free.  When asked about their policy a lady who spoke with me stated it’s their policy.  Then went the route of telling me a hypothetical situation like “...if a technician comes out...whatever he touches ... he’s responsible for...that’s why we charge the fee.”  So I asked, “...so if he comes out and everything is ok and it just needs a service do you skip the $198 charge?”  She said”no.” I thanked her and found another Generac dealer company that has already provided me with a service date.  Be aware of your future responsibilities to this company that installs your generator.

resp.text: Hi! Thank you for leaving a review. As we stated to you and is our policy that is listed in our documents and verbalized, we service and maintain what we sell and once that service is declined we do charge a rate to come back out on top of our service rate. We would love to speak more about this with you.

There is a lot of work involved with the training of staff and all that is involved with the coordination of an install. I personally care about how i treat our customers and how they are treated by our staff and have grown to know the owner, front office staff and installers and know they feel the same. As with any company we do make mistakes,  and work as a team to constantly improve. We all receive training on a monthly basis and are always looking for ways to improve our processes.

name: Robert Carrell
text:
I received quotes from three providers and ultimately chose CURRENT ELECTRIC SERVICE, LACEY'S SPRING, ALABAMA for install my standby generator.  They arrived, placed a pad and installed the generator.  The guy who seemed to be in charge said that they had checked the generator and it was good to go.  My wife and I discovered that the green light, indicating that the generator was functional, was not on.  A red light was on.  This was at 11:30pm at night.  It wasn't running or doing anything weird, so I called the Generac corp. office and a man there told me how to turn the generator off.  I did such and the next day, I called CES to inform them of the problem.  I had to tell my story to three different people.  THEN they said that the owner would have to talk to me to get an 'OK' for a service call.(?)  So, I called him and he proceeded to criticize how I had handled the situation.  I didn't want to call someone out in the middle of the night for, what appeared to be a non emergency problem.  He finally okayed a tech to come out.  The tech could not find anything wrong after a 'thorough and complete' exam.
About 10 days later, my wife and I were out in the yard and we heard a very loud clang sound.  Repeatedly , a harsh noise seemed to be coming from the transfer switch that goes  to the generator.   We called CES and had to tell our story to three people again and, as it was 4:30pm, we finally were referred to "Buddie", who said that everyone had gone home for the day.  This was their response to what sounded like a very damaging situation occurring.  I demanded to talk to the owner.  He called again and criticized me again for how I had handled the situation.  He also was abusive about how I had spoken to his employees.  The best defense is, apparently, still a good offense.  So, I went on defense reflexively.  I just wanted the machine to be fixed.  He said that it was the Huntsville Utilities problem.  He said, reluctantly, that he would call back a tech who lived in Guntersville to make a service call.  I called HU and they had no complaints of outages.  I also checked with both neighbors, who had no problem.  At this  point, the HU tech came out and he said that everything on the electrical service was in good working order.  The technician from CES arrived and examined the generator. He said that he had never seen anything like this problem before.  GREAT!!   So, he increased the idle time between my service going out and the generator startup. His parting words were that he would call Generac and find out what the problem was and would call me.  RIGHT!!   At this juncture I had had enough of CES and I transferred my warranty to Mr. Electric.  Days later the same scenario occurred with harsh clashing sounds coming from the transfer switch.   I called Mr. Electric and one person handled the problem and sent out a service tech.  He discovered that two color-coded wires had been installed to the wrong color-coded positions, rendering the machine sensing low wattage coming into my house from HU.  He took pictures of the situation and re installed the correct color wire to the correct color position and the problem was solved.  He asked if the CES techs had performed a post installation check on the generator, because this incorrect wiring pattern would have been discovered if CES had done a post installation check.  I told him that the CES guy told me that they had done the check up.  EVIDENTLY NOT!!!  He showed me the reading on the machine with the crossed wires was stimulating the generator to turn on.  The wattage read on the LED was low.  He fixed this problem and looked the entire installation over.  I have to give at least one star to CES in order to get this posted, so  one star to CES for having a pulse.  Five stars to Mr. Electric.
